src: Good pilgrim, you do wrong your hand too much, Which mannerly devotion shows in this; For saints have hands that pilgrims' hands do touch, And palm to palm is holy palmers' kiss.
trg: Have not saints lips, and holy palmers too?

src: Will't please your mightiness to wash your hands? O, how we joy to see your wit restored! O, that once more you knew but what you are! These fifteen years you have been in a dream;
trg: Or when you waked, so waked as if you slept.

src: How many days will finish up the year; How many years a mortal man may live. When this is known, then to divide the times: So many hours must I tend my flock; So many hours must I take my rest;
trg: So many hours must I contemplate; So many hours must I sport myself; So many days my ewes have been with young; So many weeks ere the poor fools will ean: So many years ere I shall shear the fleece:

src: He hath promised you more than that, or there be liars.
trg: He hath paid you all he promised you; may be, he has paid you more, which will shame you to give him again.

src: he is a flatterer, A parasite, a keeper back of death, Who gently would dissolve the bands of life, Which false hope lingers in extremity.
trg: Here comes the Duke of York.

src: For one poor grain or two! I am one of those; his mother, wife, his child, And this brave fellow too, we are the grains: You are the musty chaff; and you are smelt Above the moon:
trg: we must be burnt for you.

src: But for our trusty brother-in-law and the abbot, With all the rest of that consorted crew, Destruction straight shall dog them at the heels.
trg: Good uncle, help to order several powers To Oxford, or where'er these traitors are: They shall not live within this world, I swear, But I will have them, if I once know where. Uncle, farewell:

src: Upon the stroke of four.
trg: Cannot thy master sleep these tedious nights?

src: And therefore has he closely mew'd her up, Because she will not be annoy'd with suitors.
trg: Ah, Tranio, what a cruel father's he! But art thou not advised, he took some care To get her cunning schoolmasters to instruct her?

src: How art thou out of breath, when thou hast breath To say to me that thou art out of breath? The excuse that thou dost make in this delay Is longer than the tale thou dost excuse.
trg: Is thy news good, or bad? answer to that; Say either, and I'll stay the circumstance: Let me be satisfied, is't good or bad?

src: A most courteous exposition.
trg: Nay, I am the very pink of courtesy.

src: Well, my lord, If you may please to think I love the king And through him what is nearest to him, which is Your gracious self, embrace but my direction:
trg: If your more ponderous and settled project May suffer alteration, on mine honour, I'll point you where you shall have such receiving As shall become your highness;

src: For God's sake, lords, give signal to the fight.
trg: What say'st thou, Henry, wilt thou yield the crown?

src: With a proud heart he wore his humble weeds. will you dismiss the people?
trg: How now, my masters! have you chose this man?

src: Know, sir, that I am call'd Hortensio.
trg: Signior Hortensio, I have often heard Of your entire affection to Bianca;

src: Know, I pray you,--
trg: I know no further: Let them pronounce the steep Tarpeian death, Vagabond exile, raying, pent to linger But with a grain a day, I would not buy Their mercy at the price of one fair word;

src: Madam, with all my heart.
trg: Send to her, by the man that slew her brothers, A pair of bleeding-hearts; thereon engrave Edward and York; then haply she will weep:

src: My comfort is that heaven will take our souls And plague injustice with the pains of hell.
trg: My Lord Northumberland, see them dispatch'd. Uncle, you say the queen is at your house; For God's sake, fairly let her be entreated: Tell her I send to her my kind commends;

src: You have stood your limitation; and the tribunes Endue you with the people's voice: remains That, in the official marks invested, you Anon do meet the senate.
trg: Is this done?

src: Bum, sir.
trg: Troth, and your bum is the greatest thing about you; so that in the beastliest sense you are Pompey the Great.

src: How shall this bisson multitude digest The senate's courtesy? Let deeds express What's like to be their words: 'we did request it; We are the greater poll, and in true fear They gave us our demands.
trg: ' Thus we debase The nature of our seats and make the rabble Call our cares fears; which will in time Break ope the locks o' the senate and bring in The crows to peck the eagles.

src: I, as I may--that which I would I cannot,-- With best advantage will deceive the time, And aid thee in this doubtful shock of arms:
trg: But on thy side I may not be too forward Lest, being seen, thy brother, tender George, Be executed in his father's sight. Farewell:

src: Flatter my sorrows with report of it; Tell me what state, what dignity, what honour, Canst thou demise to any child of mine?
trg: Even all I have; yea, and myself and all, Will I withal endow a child of thine;

src: And living too; for now his son is duke.
trg: Barely in title, not in revenue.

src: What, my old worshipful old master? yes, marry, sir: see where he looks out of the window.
trg: Is't so, indeed.

src: O my brother, Good gentleman! the wrongs I have done thee stir Afresh within me, and these thy offices, So rarely kind, are as interpreters Of my behind-hand slackness.
trg: Welcome hither, As is the spring to the earth.

src: My brother was too careless of his charge. But let us hence, my sovereign, to provide A salve for any sore that may betide.
trg: My lord, I like not of this flight of Edward's; For doubtless Burgundy will yield him help, And we shall have more wars before 't be long.

src: On me, that halt and am unshapen thus? My dukedom to a beggarly denier, I do mistake my person all this while: Upon my life, she finds, although I cannot, Myself to be a marvellous proper man.
trg: I'll be at charges for a looking-glass, And entertain some score or two of tailors, To study fashions to adorn my body: Since I am crept in favour with myself, Will maintain it with some little cost.

src: Petruchio, go thy ways; the field is won.
trg: Well, forward, forward! thus the bowl should run, And not unluckily against the bias. But, soft! company is coming here. Good morrow, gentle mistress: where away?

src: We'll hear no more. Pursue him to his house, and pluck him thence: Lest his infection, being of catching nature, Spread further.
trg: One word more, one word. This tiger-footed rage, when it shall find The harm of unscann'd swiftness, will too late Tie leaden pounds to's heels. Proceed by process;

src: the one He chides to hell and bids the other grow Faster than thought or time.
trg: Worthy Camillo, What colour for my visitation shall I Hold up before him?

src: Now, in good time!
trg: Not a word, a word; we stand upon our manners. Come, strike up!

src: My power? Alas, I doubt--
trg: Our doubts are traitors And make us lose the good we oft might win By fearing to attempt. Go to Lord Angelo, And let him learn to know, when maidens sue, Men give like gods;

src: Thieves are not judged but they are by to hear, Although apparent guilt be seen in them;
trg: And shall the figure of God's majesty, His captain, steward, deputy-elect, Anointed, crowned, planted many years, Be judged by subject and inferior breath, And he himself not present?

src: For we are soft as our complexions are, And credulous to false prints.
trg: I think it well: And from this testimony of your own sex,-- Since I suppose we are made to be no stronger Than faults may shake our frames,--let me be bold; I do arrest your words.

src: I took an oath that he should quietly reign.
trg: But for a kingdom any oath may be broken: I would break a thousand oaths to reign one year.

src: You're welcome, sir; and he, for your good sake. But for my daughter Katharina, this I know, She is not for your turn, the more my grief.
trg: I see you do not mean to part with her, Or else you like not of my company.

src: But if you ever chance to have a child, Look in his youth to have him so cut off As, deathmen, you have rid this sweet young prince!
trg: Away with her; go, bear her hence perforce.

src: Spies of the Volsces Held me in chase, that I was forced to wheel Three or four miles about, else had I, sir, Half an hour since brought my report.
trg: Who's yonder, That does appear as he were flay'd? O gods He has the stamp of Marcius; and I have Before-time seen him thus.

src: If any thing fall to you upon this, more than thanks and good fortune, by the saint whom I profess, I will plead against it with my life.
trg: Pardon me, good father; it is against my oath.

src: Would it were mortal poison, for thy sake!
trg: Never came poison from so sweet a place.

src: Lords, give us leave: I'll try this widow's wit.
I will not peace. What is the matter, Aumerle.
trg: Good mother, be content; it is no more Than my poor life must answer.

src: 'Tis set down so in heaven, but not in earth.
trg: Say you so? then I shall pose you quickly. Which had you rather, that the most just law Now took your brother's life;

src: So play the foolish throngs with one that swoons; Come all to help him, and so stop the air By which he should revive:
trg: and even so The general, subject to a well-wish'd king, Quit their own part, and in obsequious fondness Crowd to his presence, where their untaught love Must needs appear offence. How now, fair maid?
